org.TheGivingChild.Screens

Class ScreenEditor

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.badlogic.gdx.ScreenAdapter
      • org.TheGivingChild.Screens.ScreenEditor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.badlogic.gdx.Screen

    class ScreenEditor
extends com.badlogic.gdx.ScreenAdapter
    This is the Editor Screen This allows user to place objects with attributes on a screen and then export the level with a correct XML file.
    Author:
    Nathaniel Jacobi

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private class  ScreenEditor.EditorTextInputListener
      Class for the little textBox that comes up when the screen is shown

    • Constructor Detail

      • ScreenEditor

        public ScreenEditor()
        The constructor for the screen editor. Gets the main game and the asset manager. Creates its button table, the dialog, and fills the grid.

    • Method Detail

      • hide

        public void hide()
        Hides the editor button table and the GameObject dialog window if it's up.
        Specified by:
        hide in interface com.badlogic.gdx.Screen
        Overrides:
        hide in class com.badlogic.gdx.ScreenAdapter

      • render

        public void render(float delta)
        Draws the screen transition when the screen is shown. When transition is complete, if draws the grid and all GameObjects added. Also controls the drawing of the button table, so that it is hidden when not moused over or tapped. If the screen ever has a isTouched input call, spawnObject() is called.
        Specified by:
        render in interface com.badlogic.gdx.Screen
        Overrides:
        render in class com.badlogic.gdx.ScreenAdapter
        Parameters:
        delta - Amount of time passed between each render call. In seconds

      • show

        public void show()
        Called when the screen is selected and everything is rendered. Adds the editorTable to the game's stage and has the levelName window pop.
        Specified by:
        show in interface com.badlogic.gdx.Screen
        Overrides:
        show in class com.badlogic.gdx.ScreenAdapter

      • createEditorTable

        private void createEditorTable()
        Function that sets up the buttonTable at the bottom of the screen Calls createButtons() to add to the table.

      • fillGrid

        private void fillGrid()
        Creates the grid used for the editor. Based on the gridImage size that will be used and the screen size. Initializes rectangles to go with the images to deal with detection.

      • spawnObject

        private void spawnObject()
        Called when Gdx.input.isTouched() is true, so there was a touch on the screen. If the user is able to make a GameObject, the object is placed in a particular place. It checks the grid rectangles to see which one was touched and this is where the GameObject will go. If there is a GameObject there already, it replaces it and assumes its ID. It is then added to and array of GameObject, and the canSetObj boolean is reset.

      • selectImage

        private void selectImage()
        Increments every time the ballButton is pressed and selects a particular image for the object to use

      • enableButtons

        private void enableButtons()
        Shows the editorButtonTable when applicable.

      • disableButtons

        private void disableButtons()
        Shows the editorButtonTable when applicable.

      • createButtons

        private void createButtons()
        Creates (for now) all the buttons that are going to be used by the screen First the table buttons are created and added. Then the dialog window's buttons are created and added.

      • resetCheckBoxes

        private void resetCheckBoxes()
        Resets all of the CheckBoxes used to see what Attribute and InputListeners are wanted.

      • attributesSelected

        private com.badlogic.gdx.utils.ObjectMap<Attribute,com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Array<java.lang.String>> attributesSelected()
        Goes through all of the Attribute CheckBoxes and if they are checked, it adds the Attribute and it's needed values to a temporary data structure that is returned and used to initialize a GameObject.
        Returns:
        Returns an ObjectMap with Attribute keys and an Array of Strings for it's values of all of the attributes that were selected.

      • listenersSelected

        private com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Array<java.lang.String> listenersSelected()
        Goes through all of the InputListners CheckBoxes and if they are checked, it adds the InputListener a to a temporary data structure that is returned and used to initialize a GameObject.
        Returns:
        Returns an Array of Strings with InputListeners that were selected.
